Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; trace of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre and trace of two white bands below; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (noted in Gardner's plate)
Curator's comments: Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. The number 22 is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior surface. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 79 and pl. 35, 19)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 680, no. 391)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1801) (phase 2)
